refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: If subclassed, Nemo will request a list of custom property pages that should appear when a user opens the Properties dialog for a file or folder.

example.title: Nemo.PropertyPageProvider Example
example.programlisting:
import hashlib
# A way to get unquote working with python 2 and 3 try: from urllib import unquote except ImportError: from urllib.parse import unquote
from gi.repository import Nemo, Gtk, GObject
class MD5SumPropertyPage(GObject.GObject, Nemo.PropertyPageProvider): def __init__(self): pass
def get_property_pages(self, files): if len(files) != 1: return
file = files[0] if file.get_uri_scheme() != 'file': return
if file.is_directory(): return
filename = unquote(file.get_uri()[7:])
self.property_label = Gtk.Label('MD5Sum') self.property_label.show()
self.hbox = Gtk.HBox(homogeneous=False, spacing=0) self.hbox.show()
label = Gtk.Label('MD5Sum:') label.show() self.hbox.pack_start(label, False, False, 0)
self.value_label = Gtk.Label() self.hbox.pack_start(self.value_label, False, False, 0)
md5sum = hashlib.md5(filename.encode("utf-8")).hexdigest() self.value_label.set_text(md5sum) self.value_label.show()
return Nemo.PropertyPage(name="NemoPython::md5_sum", label=self.property_label, page=self.hbox),

refsect2.title: Nemo.PropertyPageProvider.get_pages
refsect2.para: This function is called by Nemo when it wants property page items from the extension. It is called in the main thread before a property page is shown, so it should return quickly.
